page.title: 05WILD LIFE, BURSTON AREA
page.content:
As the area is so rural and rich in hedgerows and trees, it is therefore rich in wild life. Rabbits and hares take advantage of the protection of the hedgerows and the young trees planted to replace those lost because of disease have to be protected from the attention of hares.
The area is used for shooting and on one farm a wet area unsuitable for farming has been planted with trees to provide cover for pheasants.
Other animals are present, for example foxes, which are hunted, badgers, squirrels and the abundant trees and hedges make the area rich in wild birds and insects.
